Book Description

"Honey et Ketchup" tells the heartwarming story of a child whose father has a new girlfriend who speaks English. The girlfriend has a son the same age as our protagonist, but he also speaks English. They're from Australia.

The father is certain the children will get along well, but our protagonist wonders: will they be able to understand each other despite the language barrier?

"Papa a une nouvelle amoureuse et elle parle anglais. Son fils a mon âge, mais parle anglais lui aussi. Ils viennent de l'Australie. Papa est certain qu'on va bien s'entendre, mais allons-nous nous comprendre?"

Book Details

Book Review

5/5 Highly Recommended

"Honey et Ketchup" is a delightful children's book that explores the complexities of communication, blended families, and cross-cultural friendships. The title itself cleverly represents a mix of cultures (using both English "Honey" and French "et" meaning "and"), mirroring the blending of families in the story.

Jonathan Bécotte creates a relatable protagonist who faces the uncertainty of meeting new family members who speak a different language. The story captures the anxiety, curiosity, and eventual joy that can come from bridging cultural and language gaps.

With beautiful illustrations by Sabrina Gendron, the book creates a visual language that helps readers understand how connections can form even when words aren't shared. The book's 64 pages provide plenty of space for character development while keeping the story accessible for young readers.

This book is perfect for children experiencing blended families, those learning a second language, or anyone interested in stories about friendship that transcends barriers. It teaches important lessons about patience, understanding, and the universal language of friendship.

Book Review Editor

May 4, 2025

Activities for Young Readers

Language Learning

Try learning 5 words in a different language. Start with simple greetings or words you use every day.

Learn More
Visual Communication

Draw a picture showing how friends can communicate without words. Use facial expressions and gestures.

Learn More
Mini-Dictionary

Create a "language bridge" by making a mini-dictionary of important words that would help you make friends.
